articles.title: CBS cancels Stephen Colbert’s show days after Trump settlement criticism - Politico
articles.description: The late-night host had scoffed at a decision by CBS’s parent company to pay the U.S. president $16 million over a disputed interview.
articles.content: Press freedom groups and advocates said Trumps lawsuit, which accused CBS of editing the interview to portray Harris more favorably, was frivolous and the settlement, according to them, will further … [+645 chars]

articles.title: Kate Beckinsale mourns the death of her mother, actress Judy Loe: 'I am paralysed' - AOL.com
articles.description: Kate Beckinsale announced the July 15 death of her mother, actress Judy Loe, who endured a long battle with cancer and died 'in my arms after immeasurable suffering,' the 'Underworld' franchise star wrote.
articles.content:
Kate Beckinsale is mourning the death of her mother, actress Judy Loe.
The Underworld star announced her mom's death in a social media post on Thursday. Loe was 78 and had endured a long battle with… [+2340 chars]

articles.title: ‘Billy Joel: And So It Goes’ Review: Documentary of the Piano Man on HBO Max - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: A sprawling, worshipful documentary follows the singer-songwriter from his Long Island youth to the peak of his pop stardom and beyond.
articles.content: Billy Joel fans are protective, passionate, number in the millions, and the object of their devotion occupies a singular place in the pop-music pantheon. One would have to be beyond hardcore, though,… [+858 chars]

articles.title: Connie Francis Dies: ‘Who’s Sorry Now?’, ‘Stupid Cupid’ Singer Who Enjoyed Viral Comeback Was 87 - Deadline
articles.description: Connie Francis, the immensely popular mid-century pop singer known for songs such as "Who's Sorry Now?" and "Pretty Little Baby" died Wednesday.
articles.content: Connie Francis, the immensely popular mid-century pop singer known for teary ballads exemplified by “Who’s Sorry Now?” and jaunty, infectious near-novelty records “Stupid Cupid” and “Vacation,” died … [+3305 chars]
